title: Extreme bloom of toxic algae swirls in Nevada's 'Pyramid Lake' — Earth from space
summary: A 2024 satellite photo shows an unusually active bloom of toxic cyanobacteria swirling in the water of Nevada's Pyramid Lake. Research suggests that the algae has been blooming there for at least 9,000 years.

title: 'Sophisticated' Bronze Age city unearthed in Kazakhstan 'transforms our understanding of steppe societies'
summary: Archaeologists in Kazakhstan have discovered the "City of Seven Ravines," a vast Bronze Age "proto-city" with metalworking, dwellings and a large building.

title: ماذا قال توم كروز عند تسلمة أول أوسكار في مسيرته الفنية؟
summary: أشاد النجم الأميركي توم كروز بتأثير السينما وقدرتها على تغيير حياة الناس، وذلك خلال تسلمه جائزة أوسكار فخرية في حفل نظمته أكاديمية فنون وعلوم الصور المتحركة في لوس أنجلوس، حيث احتفت هوليوود بمسيرته الممتدة لأكثر من 45 عاماً وبإسهاماته في صناعة السينما.

title: Mars orbiter narrows down the exact path of interstellar comet 3I/ATLAS by 'ten-fold,' surprising scientists
summary: Scientists from the European Space Agency have significantly narrowed down the trajectory of the interstellar visitor 3I/ATLAS thanks to data from the alien comet's recent flyby of Mars, allowing for more accurate future observations.

title: 'Nothing but a nightmare': Worker ants are tricked into murdering their mom by an imposter queen — who quickly takes the throne for herself
summary: A sneaky spray of chemicals makes ant workers turn on their own mother — the queen — so a parasitic invader can take over the colony herself.

title: A Collision With Space Debris Leaves 3 Chinese Astronauts Stranded in Orbit
summary: The only craft docked at Tiangong space station has been damaged and “does not meet the release conditions for a safe manned return.”

title: How did metamorphosis evolve?
summary: While it might seem like an all-or-nothing process, insect metamorphosis likely emerged through gradual evolutionary changes.

title: 16 Best Subscription Boxes for Kids (2025): STEM, Books, Clothes, Snacks
summary: These monthly deliveries get kids coding and cooking while encouraging them to learn science and read about the world.

title: How Genes Have Harnessed Physics to Grow Living Things
summary: The same pulling force that causes “tears” in a glass of wine also shapes embryos. It’s another example of how genes exploit mechanical forces for growth and development.

title: Were there female gladiators in ancient Rome?
summary: Rome is famous for its gladiators, but were any of these fighters women?

title: What's the darkest place in the solar system? What about the universe?
summary: Space looks very dark from Earth. But does the solar system, and the universe for that matter, have an area that's the darkest of all?

title: Astrophotographer snaps 'absolutely preposterous' photo of skydiver 'falling' past the sun's surface
summary: Astrophotographer Andrew McCarthy has snapped a striking shot of a skydiving YouTuber perfectly aligned with the fiery surface of the sun. The unlikely image, dubbed "The Fall of Icarus," required meticulous planning to pull off.

title: Mammoth RNA sequenced for the first time, marking a giant leap toward understanding prehistoric life
summary: Scientists successfully sequence the RNA from woolly mammoths found in Siberia that lived up between 10,000 thousand and 50,000 years ago.

title: Giant North American 'hell pigs' could crunch bones like lions 30 million years ago, tooth analysis reveals
summary: Archaeotherium, or North American "hell pigs," had different feeding strategies depending on their size, according to preliminary research presented at the Society of Vertebrate Paleontology 2025 annual meeting.

title: Eruptions of ocean volcanoes may be the echoes of ancient continental breakups
summary: Waves in Earth's mantle created by the rifting of continents may peel the planet's crust from below, feeding volcanoes in the middle of the ocean.

title: Chinese astronauts are back on Earth after suspected 'space junk' strike left them stranded in space
summary: The Shenzhou-20 crew of Chen Dong, Wang Jie and Chen Zhongrui have landed back on Earth after a suspected piece of space junk left them stranded on China's Tiangong space station.

title: Science history: Chemists discover buckyballs — the most perfect molecules in existence — Nov. 14, 1985
summary: Over a feverish 10-day period, scientists synthesized and described a new class of carbon molecules, called buckminster fullerenes, after the iconic 20th-century inventor.

title: New image of 'other comet ATLAS' reveals it's breaking apart ahead of close approach to Earth
summary: New images show that comet C/2025 K1 (ATLAS) has fragmented after passing its closest point to the sun, ahead of its close approach to Earth later this month. This is not the interstellar comet 3I/ATLAS.

title: Earth's magnetic field has a weak spot — and it's getting bigger, putting astronauts and satellites at risk
summary: This could be bad news for satellites and spacefarers.

title: Parts of Arizona are being sucked dry, with areas of land sinking 6 inches per year, satellite data reveals
summary: Groundwater extraction has caused parts of the Willcox Basin to subside by up to 12 feet since the 1950s. New research reveals that some areas sunk by 3 feet in just 4 years.

title: 240 million-year-old 'warrior' crocodile ancestor from Pangaea had plated armor — and it looked just like a dinosaur
summary: The armor-plated lizard is an ancestor of modern crocodiles and lived just before dinosaurs took over Earth.

title: Underwater volcano off Oregon coast likely won't erupt until mid-to-late 2026
summary: Researchers thought that Axial Seamount might erupt in 2025, but recent data suggest the underwater volcano could take a bit longer to blow its top.

title: Scientists detect monster blast from nearby star powerful enough to rip the atmosphere off a planet
summary: In a small blow to the search for extraterrestrial life, a nearby star shot out a strong enough coronal mass ejection to strip away the atmosphere of any rocky planets that could have been in the way.

title: Blue Origin New Glenn rocket: New launch window for historic Mars mission after solar storm delay
summary: Twin Mars spacecraft were due to launch on Blue Origin's New Glenn rocket on Nov. 12, but an active sun prompted NASA to delay its mission until Thursday (Nov. 13).

title: Ancient DNA reveals mysterious Indigenous lineage that lived in Argentina for nearly 8,500 years — but rarely interacted with others
summary: A previously unknown Indigenous population lived in central Argentina for nearly 8,500 years, a new genetic study finds.
